snippet: The rush of refugees into Europe has stirred new urgency among Western leaders to address the war in Syria and push harder for an end to it.
abstract: Influx of Syrian refugees into Europe, coupled with fear Islamic State militants may cross Continent’s porous borders, spurs world leaders to request meeting with Antonio Guterres, United Nations high commissioner for refugees; Guterres has been pleading Syrian refugee cause to international community since 2011 but is only now getting response; four million refugees have arrived in Europe from Syria since 2011, and Guterres expresses opinion that sudden attention to crisis is simply because it is now impacting wealthy nations.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The rush of refugees into Europe has stirred new urgency among Western leaders to address the war in Syria and push harder for an end to it.

headline.print_headline: Influx Puts Refugee Crisis on West’s Agenda
headline.main: Refugee Crisis in Europe Prompts Western Engagement in Syria
